com.here.android.mpa.search

Class GeocodeRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.search.Request<java.util.List<GeocodeResult>>
      • com.here.android.mpa.search.GeocodeRequest

  • public class GeocodeRequest
extends Request<java.util.List<GeocodeResult>>
    The GeocodeRequest represents an extended Request used to retrieve GeocodeResult data by way of Geocoder search services.

    Note: the response to a GeocodeRequest is a list of GeocodeResult objects.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeocodeRequest

        public GeocodeRequest(java.lang.String query)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a geocoder request that resolves a free text query into a GeocodeResult.

        Please note that if this free text query contains search area information, such as a state, then the search area set through GeocodeRequest.setSearchArea(GeoBoundingBox) or GeocodeRequest.setSearchArea(GeoCoordinate, int) is ignored. For example, a search for "Main St, Ohio" with a search area of New York City will return results outside of New York City. However, a search for "Park Ave" with New York City as the search area will return results in that area.

        Parameters:
        query - Query text specifying the address to locate.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Upon a failure to handle a passed argument.

    • Method Detail

      • setSearchArea

        public GeocodeRequest setSearchArea(GeoCoordinate center,
                                    int radius)
        Sets the suggested search area using a center location and radius.

        Please note that the Search Area is only used for online geocode requests.

        Parameters:
        center - TheGeoCoordinate representing the search area center location.
        radius - The search area circle radius in meters (greater-equal than 0).
        Returns:
        The GeocodeRequest.

      • setSearchArea

        public GeocodeRequest setSearchArea(GeoBoundingBox boundingArea)
        Sets the suggested search area using a GeoBoundingBox.

        Please note that the Search Area is only used for online geocode requests.

        Parameters:
        boundingArea - TheGeoBoundingBox representing the search area.
        Returns:
        The GeocodeRequest.

      • getCollectionSize

        public int getCollectionSize()
        Gets the current collection size being used for request responses.
        Overrides:

        See Also:

      • setCollectionSize

        public GeocodeRequest setCollectionSize(int value)
        Sets a collection size to be used for request responses. The maximum number of result items in each collection will be limited to this value. The valid value range is [1..100]. The default collection size is 20.
        Overrides:
        setCollectionSize in class Request<java.util.List<GeocodeResult>>
        Parameters:
        value - Desired response collection size per request.
        Returns:
        This Request object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is out of range.
        See Also:
        SearchRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, TextAutoSuggestionRequest

      • setMapViewport

        public GeocodeRequest setMapViewport(GeoBoundingBox mapViewport)
        The map viewport is a bounding box of the map area currently visible to the user. The viewport can act as an implicit location context in the absence of an explicit location context. To ensure you get the best results possible, you should always set a viewport if there is a map visible to the user.

        Please note that the Map Viewport is only used for online geocode requests.

        Overrides:
        setMapViewport in class Request<java.util.List<GeocodeResult>>
        Parameters:
        mapViewport - The bounding box of the map area currently visible.
        Returns:
        The updated Request object itself.
        See Also:
        SearchRequest, ExploreRequest, HereRequest, TextAutoSuggestionRequest

      • execute

        public ErrorCode execute(ResultListener<java.util.List<GeocodeResult>> listener)
        Executes an asynchronous request.
        Overrides:
        execute in class Request<java.util.List<GeocodeResult>>
        Parameters:
        listener - A ResultListener passed along with the request to monitor progress.
        Returns:
        The ErrorCode representing an appropriate result.
        Note:
        The ErrorCode.SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE can be returned if current search service is unavailable for your region. For more information see the Developer's Guide.
